title: UK fusion of exec legis branches

content.prompt: Which of the following is a consequence of fusing the executive and lawmaking functions?

choices.label: The legislature and executive are usually controlled by different parties.
The legislature can remove the executive through a vote of no confidence.
The legislature and executive are constitutionally arranged to function independently and have powers over each other.
Parliament is often dissolved because such a system is dysfunctional and not very efficient.
